cont.entity_a: Stopped working in less than a year. Problematic in less than bright light. Noisy but not bothersome for photos. Works well but not as fast as other lenses. Slow, especially for sports photography.
cont.entity_b: Fast and well-built. AF is a little slow.

cont.entity_a: No warranty support from Amazon. Warranty repair service was efficient, but shipping was at the user's expense. Great lens for the price with a 6-year warranty.
Workhorse, especially with the telephoto macro function. Softness at 300mm. Requires good lighting to avoid softness.
Started getting an error saying the contacts were dirty, but other lenses worked fine.
Solidly built. Lightweight and less expensive compared to Canon lenses.
cont.entity_b: Plastic build with a 1/2'' hood. Compact and versatile for general usage.

cont.entity_a: Amazing picture quality. No image stabilization, tripod recommended for low light conditions. Blue/purple fringe at 100%.
cont.entity_b: At 28mm, the lens is a bit soft but improves with lower f-stops. Sharp shots at 50mm-80mm at almost all f-stops. Mediocre performance, best at f/11.

cont.entity_a: Less expensive compared to Canon lenses. Good value for the price, especially for beginners.
Good for beginners and casual use, not for professional quality.
cont.entity_b: Not a professional lens, but suitable for amateur use.

cont.entity_a: Good for outdoor photography under good lighting.
cont.entity_b: Suitable for portraits and landscape photography. Good all-purpose lens for general use.

cont.entity_a: Noisy and slow, not suitable for astrophotography due to lens creep. Macro/normal button froze, leading to broken zoom.

cont.entity_b: Color reproduction is good without tint.
